meanings.sent1: The bird chirks loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent2: The cricket chirks in the grass at night.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse chirks happily as it scurries along.
meanings.sent4: The wind chirks through the branches like a chorus of tiny birds.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter chirks like a flock of sparrows taking flight.

meanings.definition: A short, sharp sound, as of a bird or insect.
meanings.sent1: I heard the chirks of the crickets in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The chirks of the birds filled the air with music.
meanings.sent3: The chirks of the squirrel stealing nuts made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The chirks of the old door reminded me of childhood summers.
meanings.sent5: The chirks of the typewriter echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.definition: To cheer up or make happy.
meanings.sent1: She chirks up her friend with a funny joke.
meanings.sent2: The surprise gift chirks him on his birthday.
meanings.sent3: The puppy chirks the sad child with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons chirks up the dull room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The cheerful music chirks up the atmosphere at the party.
